messages.content: What is the cost of operation for the bullock drawn 8-row pre-germinated paddy seeder-cum-herbicide applicator?
The cost of operation is ₹1,032/ha.
What initiative did KVKs establish to promote the scientific rearing of Kadaknath?
KVKs established hatcheries to promote the scientific rearing of Kadaknath.
How many varieties of cacti were introduced as alternative fodder resources?
67 varieties of cacti.
What were the nitrogen levels used in the experiment?
The graded nitrogen levels used in the experiment were 0, 50, 100, 150, and 200 kg N ha-1.
What insecticides are effective against sucking pests in taro?
Imidacloprid 17.8 SL (0.5 ml/l) and Thiamethoxam 25 WG (0.5 g/l) are effective against sucking pests in taro.
Which Indian state is the leading producer of turmeric?
Telangana is the leading producer of turmeric in India.
What is the botanical name of the plant commonly known as Malabarnut or vasaka?
The botanical name is Adhatoda vasica Nees.
What advanced technologies are being developed to improve water use efficiency in agriculture?
Advanced irrigation methods and technologies are being developed to improve water use efficiency in agriculture.
How does the planting size of kutki affect the seed rate of anta in the kutki + anta cropping system?
In the kutki + anta cropping system, the seed rate of anta is increased because kutki has a smaller plant size compared to kodo.
How can Cercospora leaf spot be managed?
Spray chlorothalonil (2.5 g/L), mancozeb (2.5 g/L), or carbendazim (1 g/L).
What role did the PR Unit play in disseminating information about ICAR activities?
The PR Unit issued press releases, organized press conferences, conducted press tours, and developed video films to disseminate information about ICAR activities and achievements.
What is the main subject of the review by A.S. Al-jarjary and colleagues?
The review discusses enhancement methods for the performance of solar collectors.
Who is the Channel Head of DD Kisan mentioned in the document?
Sh Manoj Kumar Patairiya is the Channel Head of DD Kisan.
What are some challenges associated with agri-voltaic systems?
High capital investment, maintenance challenges, and technical complexity are some challenges associated with agri-voltaic systems.
Who received the Pt. Deen Dayal Upadhyay Antyodaya ATARI Kanpur Krishi Puruskar in 2015?
Smt. Krishna Yadav from Village-Dinapur, Najafgarh.
In which regions is amaranth widely distributed?
Amaranth is widely distributed throughout both the old and new world, including the Asia-Pacific regions like India, China, Nepal, and Afghanistan.
When can green pods of winged bean be harvested?
Green pods can be harvested from about 10 weeks after sowing.
What significant advancement has been made in mushroom cultivation?
The medicinal mushroom Reishi or Ling Zhi (Ganoderma lucidum) has been successfully grown for the first time in the country.
How is black salt and dry ginger used to treat prolapsed uterus?
A paste of 50 g black salt and 50 g dry ginger is boiled in 1 litre of water, and half of the solution is given to the animal two times a day.
How is the chickpea flour slurry prepared for bokana pakodi?
The slurry is prepared using 1 kg of chickpea flour for every 250 g of bokana leaves.
Why is gender disparity in agriculture considered ridiculous according to the text?
Gender disparity is considered ridiculous because women form the core of agricultural production and sales.
How often is the verification of library books carried out?
The verification of library books is carried out annually.
What was the net income earned by Shri Nemichand Dhakar per hectare from strawberry cultivation?
He earned a net income of ₹11.60 lakh per hectare.
Why is it important to harvest cereal crops at the proper stage?
Harvesting at the proper stage is crucial for achieving good quality and optimum yields.
What is protected cultivation and how does it benefit Indian farmers?
Protected cultivation is an effective method that can help Indian farmers increase their productivity and income, provided that the structures used are sustainable and environmentally friendly.
What is the purpose of the National Talent Scholarships mentioned in the text?
The purpose of the National Talent Scholarships is to encourage talented students all over the country to pursue undergraduate courses.
Which five spices from NER have obtained GI certification?
The five spices are Naga mircha (chilli), Mizo chilli, Sikkim large cardamom, Assam Karbi Anglong ginger, and Lakadong turmeric.
What assay was standardized to determine the phenomenon of drug resistance in H. contortus?
The larval development assay (LDA) was standardized.
What role does Seed cast play in agriculture?
Seed cast helps in communication and linkages between producers, distributors, regulators, and users of seed.
What is the total demand for rice registered against the previous year's sale by OSSC?
The total demand registered was 58,862 tons, compared to the previous year's sale of 27,500 tons.
What feature allows the self-propelled vegetable planter to meter small onion bulbs or seeds without breakage?
The provision of a spoon/cup feed type mechanism facilitates metering of small onion bulbs/seeds without breakage.
How many people were reached by India's food-based safety net programs in 2020?
The programs reached out to about 800 million people in 2020.
How are weights assigned to households in the phone survey?
Households that responded to the phone survey are assigned a weight of 1, while those with zero area planted are assigned a weight of 0.83.
What role does real-time information of animal population and feed resources play in livestock management?
Real-time information is vital for the development of the livestock sector as it helps in data collection, forecasting surplus/deficit of feed resources at a micro level.
How many crop cultivars with potential for climate resilience were integrated into the seed production and supply chain?
A total of 263 crop cultivars were integrated into the mainstream seed production and supply chain.
Why are neem leaves used in the storage of pulses?
Neem leaves are put in pulse bags for storage because they affect the hatching of storage pests' eggs.
What was the location of the experiments conducted on guava orchards?
The experiments were conducted in seven different guava orchards belonging to farmers of Baruipur, Nadia, West Bengal.
What factors contributed to the successful cultivation of grapes on a commercial scale in Southern Karnataka?
The success is attributed to improvement in pruning technology and the use of growth regulating chemicals.
What specific river basin in India has been the focus of recent studies analyzing drought characteristics?
The Godavari River Basin has been the focus of recent studies analyzing drought characteristics.
What type of farming does the group manage in their grow-out and nursery ponds?
Aquaculture (fish farming).
What analytical methods were applied by Birthal et al. (2021) to study rainfall and temperature impacts on crop yield?
Descriptive statistics, Analytical framework, Generalized Method of Moments (GMM), and Fractional Multinomial Logit Model (FMLOGIT).
What poultry strain topped the hen-housed egg production test at the Bangalore centre?
The CARI-Priya strain topped the hen-housed egg production test at the Bangalore centre.
What is India's global ranking in fish production?
India is the second-largest producer of fish globally.
Which transcription factors act as central regulators of zinc deficiency response in Arabidopsis?
The transcription factors bZIP19 and bZIP23 act as central regulators.
Who is the ex-officio Minister for Animal Husbandry in the Government of Meghalaya?
Shri Prestone Tynsong.
What crop combination yielded the highest net return during the initial fruiting years for apple trees?
The highest net return during the initial fruiting years was ₹2,04,352 for the crop combination of apple + pulses + vegetables.
Which urd bean variety developed in 1975 had a significant impact on cultivation for over three decades?
The landmark variety of urd bean developed in 1975 was T9.
What is the basic architecture of Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) as referenced in the report?
The report includes a basic block diagram of ANN, which is a computational model inspired by the human brain, used in various applications including data analysis in agriculture.
What digital infrastructures have been strengthened in the ICAR AU system?

Strengthened digital infrastructures include ICAR – DC (Krishi Megh), e-enabled learning activities, implementation of Academic Management System in 52 Agricultural Universities (AUs), and development of AU – PIMS.
What yield advantage does sorghum inoculated with Azotobacter achieve?
Sorghum inoculated with Azotobacter achieves a yield advantage of 7.1%.
What is the maturity period for Bundel Berseem 6?
Bundel Berseem 6 has a maturity period of 180 days from seedling to seed maturity.
When should wettable sulphur or potassium bicarbonate be sprayed to manage powdery mildew?
They should be sprayed when powdery mildew is noticed during the last week of May, and again during June to August under specific dry or cloudy weather conditions.
What specific analysis showed the influence of NDVI values on the adoption of high-yielding varieties?
The regression analysis on the adoption of high-yielding varieties showed the influence of NDVI values during the rice season.
What is the maximum score for Academic Qualifications in the proposed revised Score Card?
The maximum score for Academic Qualifications is 15.
What was the zone of inhibition for oxytetracycline against the Pasteurella multocida P52 strain?
The zone of inhibition for oxytetracycline was 6 mm.
What additional ingredients are mixed with ground rice to prepare yeast for beer?
Leaves of jackfruit and local fern leaves are mixed with ground rice to prepare yeast for beer.
What happens to the substrate as the growth of the orchid continues?
The substrate decomposes, or the roots may start rotting, or there may be no space in pots for new roots, which necessitates repotting.
Which two crops were mentioned for intercropping with maize?
Rajmash and ragi were mentioned for intercropping with maize.
What is the unique characteristic of the finger millet germplasm with identity number IC0635027?
The finger millet germplasm with identity number IC0635027 exhibits finger blast resistance.
What is the name of the first indigenously developed golden yellow cherry tomato variety?
The variety is called Pusa Golden Cherry Tomato-2.
What issue did Dr. R.R. Hanchinal address regarding plant variety registration in India?

Dr. R.R. Hanchinal focused on the registration of plant varieties, noting that the number of applications for registration from public sector organizations is much less compared to private sector organizations.
What is the critical crop growth stage for sunflower at 45-50 days after planting for long-duration varieties?
The critical crop growth stage is flower opening.
Who is credited with the article discussing Gandhi's role as an environmentalist in the Indian Journal of Medical Research?
The article was credited to Tiwari RR, published in the Indian J Medical Res.
Which land class experienced the highest percentage increase in income?
The landless class experienced the highest percentage increase in income at 164.70%.
How many exploration missions were mounted to collect plant genetic resources from the Sardar Sarovar Catchment area?
Twelve exploration missions were mounted to collect plant genetic resources from the Sardar Sarovar Catchment area.
What is the primary goal for Krishi Vigyan Kendras in the changing agricultural scenario?
The primary goal is to manage the increased workload through areas of convergence with other institutions.
Where and when was the Global Conference on future challenges in agriculture held?
It was held from 28 to 31 May 2016 in Jalgaon, Maharashtra.
Which major crops were included in the germplasm collection?
Major crops included cereals (barley, wheat, and maize), species of Vigna, Cajanus, millets, and several others.
What is the sub-baric storage method and its purpose?
The sub-baric storage method involves placing food grains in a sealed storage structure with air removed to extend the shelf-life of the grains by limiting the growth of aerobic bacteria or fungi.
Which survey is used for the analysis in the text?
The analysis uses the Rural Economic & Demographic Survey (REDS), administered by the National Council of Applied Economic Research (NCAER).
What is the primary focus of the Indian Institute of Spices Research (SPR) in Calicut, Kerala?
The primary focus is on spices research.
What is the significance of the Farmer FIRST Programme in relation to smallholder agriculture?

The significance of the Farmer FIRST Programme lies in its focus on privileging smallholder agriculture by addressing the unique challenges faced by small and marginal farmers and enhancing the interface between farmers and scientists.
From which country were rust-resistant lines of soybean (EC 473111-38) sourced?
Taiwan.
How should the weightage for the evaluation components be structured according to the proposal?
The weightage should be 60% for written examinations, 10% for viva-voce, and 30% for assignments, communication skills, reasoning/problem solving ability, and group discussions.
How many Ph.D. theses were awarded the Jawaharlal Nehru Awards this year?
18 Ph.D. theses were awarded the Jawaharlal Nehru Awards.
What design feature does the base cutting unit of the tractor operated sugarcane cutter include?
The base cutting unit consists of four blades and provisions to change the approach angle of the cutter.
What technology is referenced in relation to nitrogen fertilizer recommendations?
A nitrogen fertilizer recommendation app is discussed as a tool for improving fertilizer management.
What are the two types of linseed varieties mentioned in the text?
The two types of linseed varieties are the white-flowered variety and the blue-flowered variety.
How did Shri Veershetty provide processing services to other farmers, and what was the cost?
He provided processing services at a minimal cost of ₹5-10 per kilogram.
What was the percentage increase in crop productivity under medium carbon strata compared to conventional practice?
The crop productivity increased by 21.5% under medium carbon strata compared to conventional practice.
How much did the gross value output generated by plantation crops increase from 2012 to a decade later?
The gross value output generated by plantation crops increased by 28% over a decade from 2012.
What type of irrigation systems can the automated sensor be used with in the rice-wheat rotation?
The automated sensor can be used in both conventional-till (CT) and zero-till (ZT) flood-irrigated systems, as well as surface drip (SD) and subsurface drip (SSD) irrigation systems.
Which energy source accounted for the highest percentage of total energy input in soybean crop production?
Chemical fertilizers accounted for 33% of the total energy input.
How much has India's import expenditure on edible oils increased from 2020-21 to 2021-22?
India's import expenditure on edible oils increased from ₹90,636 crore in 2020-21 to ₹150,800 crore in 2021-22.
What impact does rainwater harvesting have on the local ecosystem services?
Rainwater harvesting positively impacts ecosystem services such as flood control, food production, nutrient cycling, and aesthetic value.
What is the main advantage of high-density planting systems in apple cultivation?
The main advantage is that trees in high-density planting systems are more precocious, heavy yielders, and produce better quality fruits due to optimal light distribution.
What is the yield range of the CARI Dhan 5 variety?
The yield range is 4,500-5,500 kg/ha.
What indigenous micro-hydrological structure is mentioned for water management at the field scale?
Diggi is the indigenous micro-hydrological structure mentioned for water management at the field scale.
How much sediment can conservation ditches collect per hectare?
Conservation ditches can collect up to 1.0 to 1.5 tonnes of sediment per hectare.
What was the average fruit yield per tree for a 5-year-old soursop tree studied in Hawaii?
42.5 kg per tree.
Who holds the role of Technical Officer at the Indian Council of Agricultural Research?
Several individuals hold the role of Technical Officer, including Sh. R.V.S. Nagar, Sr. Bhagwat Singh, and Sh. S.P. Singh at the Indian Council of Agricultural Research.
What was highlighted as a significant event by Dr. K. Narayangowda from UAS, Bangalore?

Dr. K. Narayangowda presented the highlights of the International Farmers’ Fair, mentioning it may become an annual feature of the university and created a unique platform for different stakeholders in the farming sector.
What achievement of Indian farmers is highlighted regarding pulses?
The farmers expanded the area under pulses to the tune of 1.5 times, despite facing discouragement from successive droughts.
What percentage of scientists was recommended for promotion to Principal Scientists?
93.4% of the scientists were recommended for promotion to Principal Scientists.
Which combination was confirmed as the best treatment among colchicine alternatives?
APM (10 μM) + Trifluralin (350 μM) was confirmed as the best treatment compared to APM (10 µM) and Trifluralin (350 μM) when applied individually 24 hours after pollination.
What was the total amount of the Capital Fund reported by ICAR?
The total amount of the Capital Fund reported by ICAR was Rs. 4732.16 crore.
What is the potential yield of the brinjal variety RC Mankahmen-1?
The potential yield of the brinjal variety RC Mankahmen-1 is 340 q/ha.
What was the purpose of the export-quality CFB box designed for mango farmers?
The export-quality CFB box was designed to improve the packaging and handling of mangoes for better marketability and export potential.
What is one of the recommended irrigation practices in specific Indian states?
Adoption of life-saving irrigations is recommended in Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, and Karnataka.
What is the significance of the slope on the spread and height of apple plants according to the analysis?
The analysis indicated a significant effect of slope on the spread and height of apple plants.
What is the purpose of the new management guidelines for KVKs?
The purpose is to provide a framework for administration, finance, coordination, implementation, monitoring, and capacity development for effective implementation of the KVK system.
What was the net income per household for marginal farmers in the year 2020-21?
The net income per household for marginal farmers in 2020-21 was Rs. 170,533.
How many rounds of spray application are effective for managing pollu beetle?
Three rounds of spray application are effective for managing pollu beetle.
How much was added to the building's cost during the current year?
The amount added to the building's cost during the current year is 7,233,667 Rupees.
How can bulk orders for magazines be executed according to the subscription guidelines?
Bulk orders can be executed through railway parcels, and the name of the Railway Station and the name of the road transport company may need to be provided.
What is the subject of the research paper by Oerke EC published in 2006?
The subject is "Crop losses to pest."
In a high-density cropping model involving coconut, what was the average yield of nuts per palm per year?
The average yield was 77.86 nuts per palm per year.
What initiatives have been taken under NAHEP to support agricultural education?
Initiatives include outcome-focused trainings, establishment of Career Development Centres (CDCs), and the introduction of a Resilient Agricultural Education System (RAES).
What is the recommended addition to the boiling process to enhance the color of turmeric powder?
The addition of 0.05 to 1.0% sodium carbonate or lime (calcium carbonate) is recommended to give an intense color to the final turmeric powder.
What percentage reduction in the incidence of collar and stem rot does the biofertilizer achieve?
It reduces the incidence of collar and stem rot by 60%.
What is the required resolution for high-resolution images submitted by authors?
Images must be at a minimum resolution of 600 d.p.i. for line-drawings and 300 d.p.i. for colour or gray-scale images.
What support does the On-site Incubation mode provide to clients?
On-site Incubation provides technology up-scaling facilities, infrastructure, space, and technical inputs to maximize profits.
How much land has been covered by nutrigardens in Kiphire district?
Over 200 hectares have been covered by nutrigardens.
What are some long-term strategies discussed for forestry?
Long-term strategies include addressing climate change, carbon sequestration, tree improvement with biotechnology, management of natural resources, and environmental impact assessment.
What types of research does the Institute undertake?
The Institute undertakes basic, strategic, and applied research on temperate horticultural crops in collaboration with national and international agencies to enhance productivity and quality.
What are the symptoms of Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD) in pigs?
Symptoms include acute lameness, fever, vesicles and blisters on various body parts, salivation, hoof loss, abortion, and piglet deaths.
What new disorder affecting bael fruits has been recorded in subtropical regions of India?
A new disorder known as the shrinking of bael fruits, particularly in Narendra Bael-5, has been recorded.
Which institute in Agricultural Education has the highest revenue expenditure?
CIWA (Dte. Res. of Women in Agriculture), Bhubaneswar has the highest revenue expenditure of 2,661.60 lakh rupees.
Which organization is abbreviated as NABARD?
NABARD stands for National Bank for Agriculture & Rural Development.
What foundation did Gandhiji's vision provide for agricultural practices in India?
Gandhiji's vision provided a foundation for sustainable management of natural resources to enhance food production in India.
What solution did Prof. S. Arunachalam propose to improve the visibility of agricultural research?
He proposed the establishment of open access institutional repositories where researchers can publish their papers and make the full texts available online.
How does India's annual growth in R&D expenditures compare to that of China?
India's annual growth in R&D expenditures is 5.31 percent, which is significantly lower than China's annual growth of 16.19 percent.
How does intercropping cowpea with maize benefit the cultivation process?
It suppresses weeds and supplements nitrogen.
Who were the members nominated by the Board for the Finance Committee?

The Finance Committee members included individuals nominated by the Board, with at least one being a Board member, three persons nominated by the Visitor, and the Comptroller of the University as its Member-Secretary.
What is the height range of the Jackfruit tree mentioned in the text?
The Jackfruit tree can grow between 10 to 15 meters in height.
What ingredients are used to control arthritis in camels?
Sesamum oil and sugar are mixed together in equal proportions and rubbed on the affected part of the camel's body twice a day for three or four days.
What was the effect of elevated CO2 on the growth of major weeds in rice?
The growth and biomass of two major weeds, Echinochloa colona and Altemanthera paronychioides, in rice increased under elevated CO2.
What is the actual value for the number of partners identified for partnership development in FY 08/09?
The actual value is four partners.
How is the percentage increase in CRe 0K values from Sc1 to other scenarios characterized?
It is consistent with the corresponding change in Planar K.
How has brackish water aquaculture contributed to productivity in coastal areas of West Bengal?
The use of salt-tolerant fish species in brackish water aquaculture has increased productivity in coastal areas of South 24 Paraganas, West Bengal.
What fermentation and incubation conditions were used in preparing the tofu whey-tomato based coagulant powder?
The mixture was incubated for 7-8 hours at 25°C after being prepared from washed and ground tomatoes with fermented tofu whey.
What is a major indicator of climate change observed by respondents in rural districts?
Uncertainty in rain is a major indicator of climate change observed by respondents.
What are the key components of a hydroponic system?
Key components include growing media, air pump, and net pots.
What role does Smt. Renuka Chowdhury hold in the Indian Parliament?
Member of Parliament (Rajya Sabha).
Where are fully matured bottle gourd and ridge gourd kept for storage?
They are kept in the sun over the rooftop and in shade during rains.
What role does the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) play in supporting farmers?
ICAR activates its network of Institutes, ATARIs, and KVKs to ensure effective implementation of various schemes and initiatives for farmers.
What is the impact of the eriophyid mite Aceria cajani on pigeonpea plants?
Aceria cajani acts as a vector for the virus causing pigeonpea sterility mosaic disease, leading to significant crop damage.
What initiatives have been taken to improve agriculture in Mizoram?
The government, research institutions, and different organizations have initiated efforts to convert jhum cultivation to permanent agriculture.
What is the total budget for the NRC Plant Biotechnology project in New Delhi?
The total budget for the NRC Plant Biotechnology project in New Delhi is Rs. 1992.13 lakhs.
Which herbicide is recommended for pre-emergence application in maize and what is its trade name?
Atrazine 50% WP, with trade names Atrataf and Solaro, is recommended for pre-emergence application.
What natural farming formulations does Smt. Pinky Devi prepare?
She prepares Beejamrit, Jeevamrit, Ghanjeevamrit, and other organic pesticides.
What is the treatment method for haemorrhagic septicaemia involving gosraine leaves in Khata village?
A paste made from gosraine leaves and sira is applied.
What is the maximum capacity of grains that can be stored in one 'Khanti'?
One 'Khanti' can store 10-15 tonnes of food grains.
How are ridges and furrows formed in the ridge and furrow method?
Ridges and furrows are formed across the slope by bullock-drawn plough before the monsoon.
In which specific areas could a shift from conventional to organic farming potentially increase consumer and producer surplus?
The shift could result in an increase in surplus if confined to rainfed, hilly, and tribal areas.
What is the name of the monthly English magazine mentioned in the subscription form?
Indian Farming
What is the green fodder yield of the improved variety Jawahar Berseem 05-9?
The text does not specify the green fodder yield for Jawahar Berseem 05-9; it only lists the variety name and area of adoption.
What is the flowering duration for NICRA Aerobic Dhan 1?
NICRA Aerobic Dhan 1 comes to flowering within 85 to 86 days.
What is the seed yield per hectare for capsularis jute in drier tracts?
The seed yield per hectare for capsularis jute in drier tracts is 1.1 tonnes.
How much funding is allocated for disaster management as per the budget estimates?
The funding allocated for disaster management is 113.00 lakh.
By what percentage did the contribution of coarse cereals decline by 2011-12?
The contribution of coarse cereals declined to 8% by 2011-12.
What is necessary for the dissemination of knowledge regarding smart sensor technology to farmers?
Robust training programs and workshops facilitated by agricultural institutions, technology providers, and government agencies are necessary for disseminating knowledge about smart sensor technology.
Who disclosed the information regarding the control of caseworm using leaves of parasi and sali?
Shri Sanat Kumar Sawaiyan disclosed the information.
What social safeguard measures were taken concerning the project discussed in the text?

The project was categorized as “C” under Social Safeguard Policies, indicating no significant involuntary resettlement impact. An Equity Action Plan (EAP) was developed to incorporate social considerations in project planning and implementation.
How many households are classified as marginal landholding households?
There are 951 households classified as marginal landholding households.
What issue does the 2015 article by Joshi address regarding Indian agriculture?
It addresses whether Indian agriculture has become crowded and risky.
What is the significance of the microencapsulation process in the production of CIFTEQ® Seaweed Nutridrink?
The microencapsulation process adds to the stability and ease of packaging of the product.
How can the performance and egg shell quality of egg-laying chickens be maintained during the summer season?
By supplementing fiber hydrolyzing enzymes in their diet.
What is the recommended irrigation method and frequency?
The crop should be irrigated by flood method at 6-8 day intervals or with drip irrigation at 2–3 days for 1.5–2.0 hours.
What initiatives has the state government taken to promote millet production in Mizoram?
The state government is currently taking several initiatives to popularize millet production due to the International Year of Millets (IYM).
What is the duration in days for the Kharif dual purpose variety DSV 6 (CSV 25)?
The duration for DSV 6 (CSV 25) is 120-125 days.
What was the highest mean weight of biomass observed in the zinc nutrient loaded sachet trial (T3)?
The highest mean weight of biomass observed was 0.672 g.
What is the significance of pathotype 104-2 in relation to wheat?
Pathotype 104-2 (21R55) carries virulence for Lr 23 and Lr 26 and was frequently found in durum and dicoccum wheat areas.
What temperature is recommended for the best appearance and decay control of mango fruits?
25°C is recommended for the best appearance, palatability, and decay control of mango fruits.
How does an Image Sensor contribute to agricultural practices?
An Image Sensor takes pictures to assist in disease detection, assessing chlorophyll status, fruit ripeness, leaf area index, harvest readiness, and soil erosion analysis.
What impact has the increase in smartphone adoption among farmers had on their operations?
The increase in smartphone adoption among farmers has created new opportunities for accessing vital information, optimizing operations, and enhancing productivity and sustainability.
What is the total funding for the IISR, Lucknow?
The total funding for the IISR, Lucknow is 7739.49 lakh.
Who were the key scientists involved in the multiplication and provision of seeds for different trials?
Key scientists included Dr. I.S. Katageri, Dr. S.B. Patil, Dr. S.S. Patil, Dr. S.N. Chattonnavar, and Dr. S.S. Hallikeri.
Which fruits are mentioned as being successfully grown in the mid-hills of the Northeastern region?
Fruits such as stone fruits, walnut, kiwi, strawberry, and persimmon are successfully grown in the mid-hills.
What is the primary role of goats in the context of sustainable rural development in India?
Goats play a key role in sustainable rural development by providing a source of livelihood and nutrition for marginal and small farmers.
How much funding was provided to support activities in Agricultural Universities during the year?
An amount of ₹ 294.35 crore was provided to support various activities across Agricultural Universities.
In which year was the 4th India-ASEAN Agriculture Ministers’ Meeting held?
The 4th India-ASEAN Agriculture Ministers’ Meeting was held in January 2018.
What challenges do low-income households in Greater Accra face regarding food security?
Low-income households are stressed by rising food prices and increasing rent prices, making it difficult for them to purchase enough quantity and quality of food.
What is the destructive stage of Lymantria obfuscata and why?
The larval stage is the destructive stage because the larvae feed voraciously on foliage, causing significant damage to the trees.
What regions in Ghana were included as study areas for the research?
The study areas in Ghana included the Bono, Bono East, and Greater Accra Regions, specifically the Techiman Municipality, Sunyani Municipal, Accra Metropolis, and La Dade Kotopon Municipal.
How many outlets have been established in villages for honey sales?
11 outlets have been established in various villages.
How many institutes of ICAR were reviewed for institutional efficiency?
Seven institutes of ICAR were reviewed for institutional efficiency through a consultancy firm.
How many scientists were deputed by the Crop Science Division during the reporting period?
The Crop Science Division deputed 274 scientists during the reporting period.
Which agricultural zone is the early fruiting variety identified for?
It is identified for Zone IV, which includes Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and Jharkhand.
What change occurred in the burning of cattle dung during the Sanganakallu-Kupgal phase?
The burning of cattle dung appears to cease or at least be significantly reduced during the Sanganakallu-Kupgal phase (c. 1700–1600 BC).
What was the overall impact of training assessed for the 2,171 employees who attended training in 2020-21?
The overall impact of training was recorded as Considerable-Great Extent.
What is an effective management technique for gummosis in healthy trees?
Pasting the tree trunk with biodynamic tree paste twice a year is effective in managing gummosis.
When was VRRAD-12 registered as Unique Germplasm by the Plant Germplasm Registration Committee?
VRRAD-12 was registered as Unique Germplasm on 24th December 2021.
What does habitat restoration for C. wightii involve?
Habitat restoration involves reforestation, erosion control, and restoring arid and semi-arid habitats to preserve suitable conditions for C. wightii.
What is the advantage of the IISR Vajra variety of ginger?
The IISR Vajra variety is a high yielding, bold and plumpy rhizome variety that showed 17% higher yield over the National check across locations.
What was the cumulative total of trademark applications filed up to the reported period?
The cumulative total of trademark applications filed reached 255.
What is the purpose of the Sediment Delivery Ratio (SDR) module mentioned in the text?
To assess sediment losses from different land use and land cover classes in selected landscapes.
Who are the authors of the research on the relationship among trainees' characteristics, training design, and work environment?
The authors are Shoobridge Jodie and others, as mentioned in the text.
